segment.source: Changes to Group Policy settings for Windows 10 Start (Windows 10)
segment.target: Changes to Group Policy settings for Windows 10 Start (Windows 10)

segment.source: Windows 10 has a brand new Start experience.
segment.target: Windows 10 has a brand new Start experience.

segment.source: Changes to Group Policy settings for Windows 10 Start
segment.target: Changes to Group Policy settings for Windows 10 Start

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 has a brand new Start experience.
segment.target: Windows 10 has a brand new Start experience.

segment.source: As a result, there are changes to the Group Policy settings that you can use to manage Start.
segment.target: As a result, there are changes to the Group Policy settings that you can use to manage Start.

segment.source: Some policy settings are new or changed, and some old Start policy settings still apply.
segment.target: Some policy settings are new or changed, and some old Start policy settings still apply.

segment.source: Other Start policy settings no longer apply and are deprecated.
segment.target: Other Start policy settings no longer apply and are deprecated.

segment.source: Start policy settings supported for Windows 10 Pro, Windows 10 Enterprise, and Windows 10 Education
segment.target: Start policy settings supported for Windows 10 Pro, Windows 10 Enterprise, and Windows 10 Education

segment.source: These policy settings are available in Administrative TemplatesStart Menu and Taskbar under User Configuration.
segment.target: These policy settings are available in Administrative TemplatesStart Menu and Taskbar under User Configuration.

segment.source: Policy
segment.target: Policy

segment.source: Notes
segment.target: Notes

segment.source: Clear history of recently opened documents on exit
segment.target: Clear history of recently opened documents on exit

segment.source: Documents that the user opens are tracked during the session.
segment.target: Documents that the user opens are tracked during the session.

segment.source: When the user signs off, the history of opened documents is deleted.
segment.target: When the user signs off, the history of opened documents is deleted.

segment.source: Do not allow pinning items in Jump Lists
segment.target: Do not allow pinning items in Jump Lists

segment.source: Jump Lists are lists of recently opened items, such as files, folders, or websites, organized by the program that you use to open them.
segment.target: Jump Lists are lists of recently opened items, such as files, folders, or websites, organized by the program that you use to open them.

segment.source: This policy prevents users from pinning items to any Jump List.
segment.target: This policy prevents users from pinning items to any Jump List.

segment.source: Do not display or track items in Jump Lists from remote locations
segment.target: Do not display or track items in Jump Lists from remote locations

segment.source: When this policy is applied, only items local on the computer are shown in Jump Lists.
segment.target: When this policy is applied, only items local on the computer are shown in Jump Lists.

segment.source: Do not keep history of recently opened documents
segment.target: Do not keep history of recently opened documents

segment.source: Documents that the user opens are not tracked during the session.
segment.target: Documents that the user opens are not tracked during the session.

segment.source: Prevent changes to Taskbar and Start Menu Settings
segment.target: Prevent changes to Taskbar and Start Menu Settings

segment.source: In Windows 10, this disables all of the settings in SettingsPersonalizationStart as well as the options in dialog available via right-click Taskbar Properties
segment.target: In Windows 10, this disables all of the settings in SettingsPersonalizationStart as well as the options in dialog available via right-click Taskbar Properties

segment.source: Prevent users from customizing their Start Screen
segment.target: Prevent users from customizing their Start Screen

segment.source: Use this policy in conjunction with CopyProfile or other methods for configuring the layout of Start to prevent users from changing it
segment.target: Use this policy in conjunction with CopyProfile or other methods for configuring the layout of Start to prevent users from changing it

segment.source: Prevent users from uninstalling applications from Start
segment.target: Prevent users from uninstalling applications from Start

segment.source: In Windows 10, this removes the uninstall button in the context menu.
segment.target: In Windows 10, this removes the uninstall button in the context menu.

segment.source: It does not prevent users from uninstalling the app through other entry points (e.g. PowerShell)
segment.target: It does not prevent users from uninstalling the app through other entry points (e.g. PowerShell)

segment.source: Remove All Programs list from the Start menu
segment.target: Remove All Programs list from the Start menu

segment.source: In Windows 10, this removes the All apps button.
segment.target: In Windows 10, this removes the All apps button.

segment.source: Remove and prevent access to the Shut Down, Restart, Sleep, and Hibernate commands
segment.target: Remove and prevent access to the Shut Down, Restart, Sleep, and Hibernate commands

segment.source: This removes the Shut Down, Restart, Sleep, and Hibernate commands from the Start Menu, Start Menu power button, CTRL+ALT+DEL screen, and Alt+F4 Shut Down Windows menu.
segment.target: This removes the Shut Down, Restart, Sleep, and Hibernate commands from the Start Menu, Start Menu power button, CTRL+ALT+DEL screen, and Alt+F4 Shut Down Windows menu.

segment.source: Remove common program groups from Start Menu
segment.target: Remove common program groups from Start Menu

segment.source: As in earlier versions of Windows, this removes apps specified in the All Users profile from Start
segment.target: As in earlier versions of Windows, this removes apps specified in the All Users profile from Start

segment.source: Remove frequent programs list from the Start Menu
segment.target: Remove frequent programs list from the Start Menu

segment.source: In Windows 10, this removes the top left Most used group of apps.
segment.target: In Windows 10, this removes the top left Most used group of apps.

segment.source: Remove Logoff on the Start Menu
segment.target: Remove Logoff on the Start Menu

segment.source: Logoff has been changed to Sign Out in the user interface, however the functionality is the same.
segment.target: Logoff has been changed to Sign Out in the user interface, however the functionality is the same.

segment.source: Remove pinned programs list from the Start Menu
segment.target: Remove pinned programs list from the Start Menu

segment.source: In Windows 10, this removes the bottom left group of apps (by default, only File Explorer and Settings are pinned).
segment.target: In Windows 10, this removes the bottom left group of apps (by default, only File Explorer and Settings are pinned).

segment.source: Show Run as different user command on Start
segment.target: Show Run as different user command on Start

segment.source: This enables the Run as different user option in the right-click menu for apps.
segment.target: This enables the Run as different user option in the right-click menu for apps.

segment.source: Start Layout
segment.target: Start Layout

segment.source: This applies a specific Start layout, and it also prevents users from changing the layout.
segment.target: This applies a specific Start layout, and it also prevents users from changing the layout.

segment.source: This policy can be configured in User Configuration or Computer Configuration.
segment.target: This policy can be configured in User Configuration or Computer Configuration.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Start Layout policy setting applies only to Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education.
segment.target: Start Layout policy setting applies only to Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education.

segment.source: Force Start to be either full screen size or menu size
segment.target: Force Start to be either full screen size or menu size

segment.source: This applies a specific size for Start.
segment.target: This applies a specific size for Start.

segment.source: Deprecated Group Policy settings for Start
segment.target: Deprecated Group Policy settings for Start

segment.source: The Start policy settings listed below do not work on Windows 10.
segment.target: The Start policy settings listed below do not work on Windows 10.

segment.source: Most of them were deprecated in Windows 8 however a few more were deprecated in Windows 10.
segment.target: Most of them were deprecated in Windows 8 however a few more were deprecated in Windows 10.

segment.source: Deprecation in this case means that the policy setting will not work on Windows 10.
segment.target: Deprecation in this case means that the policy setting will not work on Windows 10.

segment.source: The “Supported on” text for a policy setting will not list Windows 10.
segment.target: The “Supported on” text for a policy setting will not list Windows 10.

segment.source: The policy settings are still in the Group Policy Management Console and can be used on the operating systems that they apply to.
segment.target: The policy settings are still in the Group Policy Management Console and can be used on the operating systems that they apply to.

segment.target: Policy
